page.title: 05ST.JOHN'CHURCH
page.content: ST.JOHN'S C.E. CHURCH IS NOT VERY BIG WITH SEATS FOR ONLY 230 PEOPLE. THIS YEAR OUR CHURCH IS 99 YEARS OLD. THE WINDOWS ARE MADE OF STAINED GLASS, THE LARGEST IS THE EAST WINDOW WITH A SCENE OF JERUSALEM ON THE FIRST EASTER MORNING. THERE IS A BEE ON THE PULPIT AND COMMUNION RAIL, THIS IS THE MARK OF THE CARVER. THE VICAR IS THE REV.CANON JOHN GOODCHILD AND THE CURATE REV. CLIVE KIRKE. THERE ARE 2 CHOIRS, OME OF BOYS THE OTHER OF GIRLS. THE FIRST SERVICE IS AT 8.00AM, WHICH IS ONCE A MONTH. THE NEXT IS AT 11.00 AM AND THE LAST AT 6.30 PM.
